intro: Astragalus clandestinus var. flossdorfii, commonly known as the Flossdorf milkvetch, is a rare and elusive plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its limited distribution and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
